contributors
r
&
MARK MANN's photographs have appeared in The Face and I.D. maga- zines. For this issue, Mann pho- tographed the authors in Manhattan File's summer fiction section.
BRET EASTON ELLIS is the author of Less Than Zero (Viking) and The Informers (Vintage), among other novels. His story in this issue, "The Minglers," is an excerpt from a work in progress, and appears in Manhat- tan File's summer fiction section.
BINNIE KIRSHENBAUM is the author of two novels, On Mermaid Avenue (Fromm) and A Disturbance in One Place (Fromm), as wel as a collection of stories, History on a Personal Note (Fromm). Last month, Granta magazine selected her as a regional winner in their Best Young American Novelists competition. Her original short fiction, "Serving," is part of Manhattan File's summer fiction section.
THOMAS BELLER is the author of Seduction Theory (W.W. Norton & Co.). For this issue, he contributes an original story, "Pears," which appears in Manhat- tan File's summer fiction section.
ANDY BELLIN is an editor at The Paris Review, and a freelance writer whose recent work has appeared in The New York Post and New Woman. He is currently working on his first novel. For this issue, Belin chronicles the tale of how the lowty frankfurter took over the Big Apple ("A Dog Tale," page 72).
special thanks to:
Guy Aroch. Johnny B., Bar Six, Suzette Bross, Mallory Crosby, Frank Chevalier, David Curcunito, Mo Daoud, Alice S. Feiring, Steven Garbarino. Michael Giltz, Francis Holland, Geoff Katz. Rose Marie Morse, Nigel Parry. George Plimpton, Johnnie Sapong, Birgit Schuler, Stephane Sednaoui, Paul Starr, Eric Striffler, Delphine Tandonnet, Francis Torres, Diana Van Buren
PLANET
NATURALLY A GREAT TASTING CIGARETTE.

10
MANHATTAN FILE june 1996

paragraphs.content: MARK MANN's photographs have appeared in The Face and I.D. maga- zines. For this issue, Mann pho- tographed the authors in Manhattan File's summer fiction section.

BRET EASTON ELLIS is the author of Less Than Zero (Viking) and The Informers (Vintage), among other novels. His story in this issue, "The Minglers," is an excerpt from a work in progress, and appears in Manhat- tan File's summer fiction section.

BINNIE KIRSHENBAUM is the author of two novels, On Mermaid Avenue (Fromm) and A Disturbance in One Place (Fromm), as wel as a collection of stories, History on a Personal Note (Fromm). Last month, Granta magazine selected her as a regional winner in their Best Young American Novelists competition. Her original short fiction, "Serving," is part of Manhattan File's summer fiction section.
THOMAS BELLER is the author of Seduction Theory (W.W. Norton & Co.). For this issue, he contributes an original story, "Pears," which appears in Manhat- tan File's summer fiction section.

ANDY BELLIN is an editor at The Paris Review, and a freelance writer whose recent work has appeared in The New York Post and New Woman. He is currently working on his first novel. For this issue, Belin chronicles the tale of how the lowty frankfurter took over the Big Apple ("A Dog Tale," page 72).

Guy Aroch. Johnny B., Bar Six, Suzette Bross, Mallory Crosby, Frank Chevalier, David Curcunito, Mo Daoud, Alice S. Feiring, Steven Garbarino. Michael Giltz, Francis Holland, Geoff Katz.
